fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Typing "${value}" causes unintended line breaks in the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new issue and open it in the old issue view;
# Type "${any_value}" (please don't use the quotes)

h3. Expected Results

The comment will have *"${any_value}"* (without the quotes)

h3. Actual Results

An unintended line break is added
!Image 2020-01-31 at 11.51.18 AM.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Workaround

Escape "{" with a backslash.
Use the new issue view as this behavior is not reproduced in it.
fields.summary: Typing "${value}" causes unintended line break in the old issue view

fields.description:
At the moment, Tasks cannot be created in a Story. The business requirement would be to create a Story (bigger task) and create Tasks under Story to distribute the tasks to users. 

Please provide an option to add Tasks in a Story.
fields.summary: Ability to create Tasks in a Story

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition

Global Issue Navigator is not displaying an exact count of issues matching JQL if the number of issues is higher than 1000
h5. Suggested Solution

It would be good if the global issue navigator showed the exact count of the issues returned by the JQL.
fields.summary: Global Issue Navigator won't displaying the exact total count of issues matching JQL if the count is higher than 1000

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The workflow property "jira.issue.editable" set to flase does not work properly in the new issue view. The assignee and request type field can still be eddited
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a workflow property for jira.issue.editable to false.
 # Now create a new issue
 # While viewing in the new issue view, transition to the status with the workflow property jira.issue.editable

h3. Expected Results

All fields are not editable
h3. Actual Results

The assignee and request type fields are editable
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: New issue view Assignee editable when Editable property set to false

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to be able to reorder the tasks and sub-tasks in the Version Report view.

I would give more flexibility to the users to rearrange tasks and subtasks in the Time Tracking.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to reorder tasks and sub-tasks in the Version Report view

fields.description:
h3. Description
Business boards don't provide a way to search by issue key, only by issue summary.
It would be nice to have this feature just like Jira Software has.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud + Business Boards

h3. Workaround
Look for issue summary, use the JQL search as usual instead of the board search or use Jira Software with Software projects.
fields.summary: Ability to look for issue keys through business board search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user try to search the group in the group picker field , it must be case sensitive.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group with *ABC*
# Go to the issue (new issue view) and search *abc* in the group picker field.

h3. Expected Results
It should return the group.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't return the group
 
h3.Workaround
Use old issue view
fields.summary: The group picker field in new issue view are case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in new issue view , the group picker field only display 20 results in the dropdown list.

h3. Suggested Solution
List all the groups in the dropdown list. When user scroll the value, it will return more value.
OR 
Introduce the group picker feature in the new issue view
 !Screenshot 2021-05-03 at 15.48.40.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-05-03 at 15.49.14.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Why this is important
 User will not know the group available.

h3. Workaround 
Use old issue view.
fields.summary: In new issue view , the "Group Picker" field should listed all groups instead of only displaying 20 groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Issue Status drop-down view is blurred in Chrome & Edge when it is zoomed at 90%

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any Jira issue via Chrome/Edge
 # Click on the *Status* drop-down
 #*  !image-2020-01-30-21-27-15-740.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The status to be shown clearly

h3. Actual Results
* Issue Status drop-down view is blurred

h3. Workaround
Change to view to 100%
fields.summary: Issue Status drop-down view is blurred in Chrome & Edge
REST API v3 call to transitions endpoint doesn't work

fields.description: I just found the Bubble Chart widget and it's really nice. However, it's a little annoying that to get even the summary on a ticket you have to open it. I would expect being able to hover (or similar interaction) to get the ticket summary.
fields.summary: Issue summary in Bubble Chart widget

fields.description:
Currently setting up locale in my preferences has been deprecated as per document 

[Set Locale|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-mypreferences-locale-get]

It would be great to have this feature while running rest api.
fields.summary: Rest api for setting up locale in mypreferences

fields.description: When I see two fields called "Resolution" and "Resolved", it's very difficult for me to determine the difference between the two because the value of "Resolved" could potentially (to a layperson) be a boolean True or False to indicate whether an issue is resolved or not. After a lot of searching/googling, I realized that the Resolved field is actually intended to indicate the date an issue was resolved and it is auto-calculated. If so, why not make it clear and rename the field to Resolution Date? Isn't that far more intuitive? It goes very well with the other field (Resolution).
fields.summary: Rename "Resolved" field name to "Resolution Date"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's only possible to generate site backups and the backup can be generated only every 48 hours.

For big Jira cloud sites with a high number of attachments and data, a single backup may take several hours to be completed (from 8 to 24 hours) and the user will need to wait more 48 hours to generate a new backup file. If an incident happens in the meantime, the user may lose a good amount of data.

h3. Suggested Solution

As a Jira user, I want to be able to create and import partial backups. This would be generated quickly, taking less time and consuming fewer resources from Jira cloud, and this would allow users to recover data from incidents quickly and reducing the data loss.
fields.summary: As a Jira Cloud user, I want to be able to generate partial backups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you copy code from some rich text app, including copying/pasting code from the issue comment into a code block, 
Jira removes the line breaks and all the code is put in a single line.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a new comment on an issue
 # Copy code block from any source to the comment
 # Add a code block to the current comment
 # Copy the previous code from the comment and paste it into the code block
 # Lines break are removed and all text is a single line

h3. Expected Results

Copy and pasting code from the comment should keep the line breaks.
h3. Actual Results

The line break are removed 
 !image-2020-01-29-11-15-28-618.png|thumbnail! 
 The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
h3. Workaround

To use the text mode or the old issue view to make this action.
fields.summary: Pasting Code in Code Sniped removes the breaklines

fields.description: Requirement -  To provide a default comment in the Work Log Description field when a user logs work
fields.summary: Ability to set a default comment in worklog description field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user is entering a comment on a smaller viewport or pastes/types a very large comment, the comment box overlays the content fields in the issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a full page issue
 # Click add comment (m)
 # Enter a large comment

h3. Expected Results

When entering a large comment it is expected that the comment box not overlay the issue view content fields.
h3. Actual Results

The comment box overlaps with the issue view content fields and covers it completely.
 [^comment box covering request details.mp4]
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: When entering a large comment, the comment box completely overlays the issue

fields.description:
Hello, I'm using a great product!

I hope that "Issue security" will support "all assigned users" rather than the current assignee.
Like assignee was in (currentUser ()) in JQL.
fields.summary: Support all assigned users in Issue Security Scheme

fields.description:
One of the principles of Kanban is '[Make policies explicit|https://leankit.com/blog/2011/06/make-process-policies-explicit/]', part of that is to communicate to everyone when a card is allowed to enter an exit a lane.

In Jira we have no way to do this now.

I did a workaround/hack by creating a swimlane called "Rules for this Lane" and making a ticket for each column that is caught in the query of the swimlane. I used the summary field to spell out the rules. 

My request is to have a field that I can write rules into called Policy for each configured column that will somehow be displayed on the board, whether by icon when hovered over or directly or a choice of both.
fields.summary: Create a place on the kanban board to make policies explicit

fields.description:
Issue - CSV export shows alphanumeric coding for the colored text 

Steps - 
- Add a description and display it in color red.
- Take CSV export of the issue
- It will show something like this {color:#36b37e}test color export{color}

Actual behaviour - Colour encoding details are shown in the export
Expected behavior - Colored text should be exported as it is
fields.summary: CSV export shows alphanumeric coding for the coloured text

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When receiving a notification from an issue update of a field that is located on the panel, the customer receives an e-mail of the link to the issue that opens in the old issue view instead of the new issue view. In spite of having the new issue view activated. This appears to occur when users use Office365 with the Safelinks options enabled.

The link contains a parameter for the tab panel
E.g.: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Aall-tabpanel

Note: this specific notification was associated with the "Original estimate" field update.
h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view the issue in the new issue view when receiving that notification.

h3. Why this is important
Customers willing to view the issue in the new issue view when clicking on the link provided in the e-mail notification get confused to visualize the issue in the old issue view.
fields.summary: New issue view should appear when user gets a notification of having an issue update

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to see the full name of the role when adding existing project members to a new role

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to "Project settings" > "People"
# Click the "Role" dropdown for an existing user

h3. Expected Results
User can view the full name of all the roles, either by in the dropdown or hovering on each of them

h3. Actual Results
Only the first 12 characters of the role name are shown. This means that if there are different role names that share the same 12 characters(ex. "Service Desk Team A" and "Service Desk Team B"), user has no way to distinguish them in this screen.

h3. Workaround
There are no workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to see the full name of the role when adding existing project members to a new role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At this moment, whenever users or admins use the "C" shortcut or the + icon on their left sidebars to create a new issue, Jira uses the */secure/QuickCreateIssue!default.jspa?decorator=none* endpoint to create the issue. In this case, if the user or admin tags another user in the description field, an email notification is sent to this user.

However, there is another endpoint that can be used to create issues, which is the */secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa*. This endpoint is used to pre-fill content into fields (such as https://rmpgmbtl.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?issuetype=10101&pid=10010, for example) and is used in other integrations, as CSTools. In this case, Jira *won't* send an email notification to users tagged in the description field.

The following video better demonstrates the problem:

 [^JRACLOUD-73733.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# try to create an issue by accessing the /secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa endpoint;
# Tag someone in the description field

h3. Expected Results
* The user who was tagged receives an email notification.

h3. Actual Results
* The user who was tagged *does not* receives an email notification.

h3. Workaround
# After creating the ticket, users or admins can tag another users in a new comment or (more complex);
# Admins can create a User picker (multiple users) custom field, add this field to the create issue screen used by the relevant project and add this User picker into the *Issue created* notification in the notification scheme used by the relevant project (the video share about the problem also has this workaround shown).
fields.summary: If the CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa endpoint is used to create issues, Jira won't send email notification for users tagged in the description field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to past an image to an issue from the issue navigator an error message is displayed.
 (x) The issue no longer exists.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy an image from an external application, such as Mac Preview;
 # Open a filter and select one issue;
 # Try to paste the image in the issue

The video reproducing the behavior: [^Screen Recording 2020-01-27 at 04.40 PM.mov]
h3. Expected Results

The attachment is pasted and no error message displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The attachment is pasted and an error is displayed.
h3. Workaround

Open the issue in a new tab and then paste the image.
fields.summary: Paste Image to an issue at Issue Navigator is Not Working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the classic New-issue view when there is a large comment and you want to add another one with a lot of content, the comment editor takes all the screen hiding the other issue content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment with much content (I used the text from Atlassian Wikipedia in the test) 
 # Try again to add a comment with the same amount of content and scroll up
# See an example in the following video  [^New comment BUG.mp4]

h3. Expected Results
When you scroll up the other issue content should be visible

h3. Actual Results
The comment editor takes all the screen


h3. Workaround

Open the issue in another tab to see the content or use the old issue view.
fields.summary: Classic New-issue view new comment taking the complete screen when there is a lot of content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
on the new issue view for Multi-line fields e.g. Description field adding an attachment file doesn’t open when clicked but rather it goes to Edit mode.

Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue on the New Issue view
# Add an  attachment file on the Description field by using the Add attachment button from the Rich text editor

h3. Expected Results
* The file should be able to open once clicked

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on the attachment, opens up the edit issue mode of the description field.

Note
The same behaviour doesn't occur on a comment field, attaching a file on a comment field works normally when trying to open it.

h3. Workaround
 Switching to the Old Issue View, you can be open the attachment.
fields.summary: Attached files to the Description Field doesn't open and goes to Edit Mode on New Issue View

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to be able to use dynamic external link for images on the New Issue View, 

h3. Why is it Important
It is important to see changes that happen on the issue view especially when working across different team. So when the external links are changed, the newer image is fetched and displayed on Jira, so teams can be able to see those changes.
fields.summary: Ability to be able to use Dynamic external link for images on New Issue View

fields.description: If typing a very long comment, you have to scroll up and down to style text. Could the text styler be sticky to the top of the page somehow?
fields.summary: Sticky Formatting Toolbar for Comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 When you have several comments and try to create a new one, you are not able to scroll back up and view old ones and also when you click on any word of the editing comment it prompts you to the end of the comment box.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue that has several comments that you need to scroll to view them all
 # Add a new comment and Scroll back up and the old comments are gone
 # While you are adding the comment if you select the cursor in one of the lines, it prompts you to the end of the last comment letter.

h3. Expected Results

Scrolling to the old comments even when creating a new comment should allow you to view them.

If you select any letter from the new comment, the cursor should maintain on it and not prompt you to the last letter of that comment.

h3. Actual Results

- Not able to scroll up to view old comments when creating a new comment.
- If you click on any spot of the new comment section the cursor should maintain in that spot if you enter new data and not prompt you to the last letter of the comment.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use a different browser, this issue is only present in Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Chrome Browser/ Issue with comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * There isn't any indication that a third-party app installation has failed due to a billing/expired evaluation issue
 * Customers are left with the impression that the product is broken and are not given any direction
 * Currently, the Manage apps > Audit log shows the site-admin having installed and then uninstalled the app immediately after installation - there is no indication that there has been a failure

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add an audit log event informing users of the billing issue instead of silently failing

h3. Why this is important
 * The product experience for potential customers is not ideal
 * Customers tend to be unaware of the issue and are left with the impression that there is a bug in our products

h3. Workaround
 * Start the third-party app installation and while the browser developer console is open. There should be a message as below:
{noformat}
{done: true, statusCode: 200, contentType: "application/vnd.atl.plugins.task.install.err+json", subCode: "upm.plugin.error.unexpected.error"}
done: true
statusCode: 200
contentType: "application/vnd.atl.plugins.task.install.err+json"
subCode: "upm.plugin.error.unexpected.error"
{noformat}
* The message is generic and can refer to another issue, but is a good starting point
fields.summary: Customers should be informed that third-party app installations are failing due to non-payment or expired evaluation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When a site-admin/Jira administrator who is not the *Organization Admin* tries to Configure a project's sender email address it returns an invalid error even if the domain is claimed as shown below:
 ** !image-2020-01-24-16-48-56-179.png!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * The domain has to be claimed & verified
 * A Site/Jira Administrator to Configure a project's sender email address
 * You will get the error message
  

h3. Expected Results
 * To have an error message saying. Eg: Only *Organization Admin* can configure the project email address.

h3. Actual Results
 * The error message is misleading, it should say "You do not have the organization administrator rights to perform this change."

h3. Workaround
 * To configure a project's sender email address, the user has to be an *Organization Admin* to make the changes/configure
fields.summary: Misleading error message while configuring a project's sender email address

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Let's say your project has multiple released or unreleased fix versions and you wish to generate a *Time Tracking Report* for all *unreleased* or *released* fix versions. 

When you select the option and click *Next*, the error "*Invalid* *Version* *selected"*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head over to one of your classic software projects
 # Reports->Time Tracking Report
 # For Fix Versions, select the option "*Unreleased Versions"* or "*Released Versions"*
 # Click *Next* 
 # Either way, both options generate the error "*Invalid versions selected*"

h3. Expected Results

A report is generated
h3. Actual Results
The error *Invalid version selected* is generated

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Generating a Time Tracking report for "unreleased" or "released" versions generates an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on a ticket from the sprint or board page a pop-up screen opens showing the issue fields, if you have select list custom fields with various options a scrollbar appears to choose the option but it disappears when trying to click on the scroll bar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create s select list single or multiple choice custom field
 # Create 15 or more options and assign it to a screen used on the view screen configuration
 # Open a ticket from the sprint or board page
 # Try to click on the scroll bar from the select list custom field

 

[^selectlistcustomfield.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

Be able to scroll up or down by clicking on it
h3. Actual Results

The selection options disappear
h3. Workaround

Interact with the issue in the full page view instead of the pop-up view.
fields.summary: Select list custom fields closing selection scrollbar when clicking on it

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When copying and pasting images from Snagit Editor, sometimes it works sometimes it simply does not work

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce (couldn't establish a pattern)
 # Copy an image from Snagit Editor
 # Paste on the comment/description field

h3. Expected Results

The image is pasted 100% of the times


Actual Results

Sometimes the images are pasted, sometimes not
h3. Notes

Tested using Chrome
h3. Workaround

Saving the image first, and then uploading to Jira.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting images from Snagit Editor is inconsistent.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Enable time tracking for classic projects button in Time Tracking is locked. User are unable to turn it off. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa
 # The toggle button is not editable. 

h3. Expected Results
The button should be enabled to allow users to turn it on/off.

h3. Actual Results
It is not working,  !image-2020-01-23-12-20-24-410.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

The REST API Call for this change is DEPRECATED. Time tracking can be disabled by hiding the *Time tracking* field in your classic projects' field configurations.
fields.summary: Toggle button for turning off the time tracking is blocked.

fields.description: I need to be able to look at all child tickets with a parentEpic that belongs to a certain project. The issues assigned to the Epics not necessarily belong to the same project as the Epic
fields.summary: JQL filter that finds all issues with a parent epic in a specific project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL search for keywords present in long text of more than 255 characters with comma-separated words in it doesn't work well
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create an issue which contains a custom field lets say *Account IDs* with this text in it

{code:java}
 GDGDGGGD83883YYE77E,HDHUJDJ7377373873,12333GDGDGGDGDGG and so on ......{code}
(make sure it exceeds 255 characters in length
 * Create a JQL -
 project = XYZ AND "Account IDs" ~ "'12333GDGDGGDGDGG" ORDER BY created DESC

h3. Expected Results
Issue should show up

h3. Actual Results
Issue is not showing up

h3. Workaround
 Suggest the customer to save the text like
{code:java}
 GDGDGGGD83883YYE77E, HDHUJDJ7377373873, 12333GDGDGGDGDGG{code}
( a comma and then space)
fields.summary: JQL search for keywords present in long text of more than 255 characters with comma separated words in it doesn't work well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is currently no way to gather the user's Location information from the current REST APIs. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-user-properties-propertyKey-get] [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-user-get]
 # [|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/#uri] [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/#api-users-account-id-manage-profile-get]
 # Both the above references return user information with the timezone, but not with the user's configured location

h3. Expected Results

Users should have a way to query the user's location information
h3. Actual Results

Currently only time zone information is being returned. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to query the user's location information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Ability to hide the multi-line text fields when empty in the issue layout

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable the functionality in issue layout, to hide the multi-line custom field when it is empty.

h3. Why this is important
The customer would like to hide the multi-line text fields when empty in the issue layout
fields.summary: Ability to hide the multi-line text fields when empty in the issue layout

fields.description:
Individuals can turn off the try now messages from project settings. 

As an example - Navigate to project and on top right you should see ( try now  -service desk ) click on try now and then turn off message which would not display the  information any more.
fields.summary: Ability to turn off try now product messages globally for all users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users are only allowed to have a single initial status after the initial transition. There may be times where users would like to begin with multiple initial statuses
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to have more than a single initial status
h3. Workaround

Create an initial status called "sort" and then branch out to multiple status
fields.summary: Allow multiple initial statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The date/time format has been changed to dd.MM.yyyy hh:mm. However, this changes does not reflect well in the new Issue view and old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to <cloud URL>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa
 # Change the format as shown below:
 #*  !image-2020-01-23-15-39-07-757.png|thumbnail! 
 # Navigate to <cloud URL>/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa
 # Update the format as shown below:
 #*  !image-2020-01-23-15-41-15-633.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Date to be reflecting as 23.05.2007 in both issue view.

h3. Actual Results
* Date is reflecting as 23/05/2007 in the new Issue view.
* Date is reflecting as 5/Dec/19 while editing the value in the old issue view as shown below:
**  !image-2020-01-23-15-43-55-673.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changes in date/time format in Jira does not reflect as changed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Jira ticket is closed, it’s not showing in search results in Jira new issue view. As such, users cannot link to it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

On Jira New View:
 # Open a Jira ticket
 # Use 'Link issue' to link a closed Jira ticket

h3. Expected Results

When typing the closed Jira ticket number under 'Search for issues', Jira should Identify the closed ticket and allow to link to it.
h3. Actual Results

Closed Jira ticket cannot be found and as such cannot be linked
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: When a Jira ticket is closed, it’s not showing in search results in Jira new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a workflow status has *jira.permission.comment.denied* set, and the user transitions an issue using that workflow to the status, it doesn't immediately disable or remove the comment box. However it will stop the comment from being persisted. It creates a bit of a bad user experience until the page is refreshed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the *jira.permission.comment.denied* property to the Closed status in a workflow.
 # Transition an issue to Closed status. Comment box is still available.

h3. Expected Results
Can't attempt to add comments.

h3. Actual Results
Comment box lets me type a comment but won't let me save.

h3. Workaround
No workaround required, since we can't actually save the comment. It's more of an improvement we could make to the UX.
fields.summary: Transitioning an issue to a workflow status with jira.permission.comment.denied does not immediately remove the comment box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Double popup while adding an attachment using the latest Chrome Version
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue from the left-hand navigation within the project
 # Click on add attachment and the popup window will come up twice

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on add attachments should prompt the attachment dialogue once
h3. Actual Results
When clicked, the dialogue pops up twice

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Double popup while adding an attachment using the latest Chrome Version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have a Next-gen project with an Epic that has a title longer than 40 characters and a Child issue on it, the 'X' icon from the right panel disappears.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select Roadmap screen and select an Epic with child issues:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # This will open the right-side panel and when selecting the child issue the 'X' icon is no longer available to close the panel:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The availability to close the right-side panel will need to remain, selecting a child issue.
h3. Actual Results

The 'X' icon disappears when selecting a child issue from an Epic on the Roadmap for a next-gen project.

h3. Workaround

Select the same Epic or a different one will make the 'X' icon visible to close the right-side panel.
fields.summary: Next-gen Roadmap screen with Task open in right panel disappears the 'X' to close it when Title of Epic is longer than 40 characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since the Issues and Filters changed to Filters, it doesn't show the starred filters in the alphabetical order, but by Starred date.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create filters with different initials.
 # Save the filter.

h3. Expected Results

New filters are automatically added under Starred and it shows in alphabetical order.
h3. Actual Results

New filters will show as the last filter of the list.

If we go to the Manage filters' page and Unstar a filter and then Star it again, the filter will also show as the last one in the list.
h3. Workaround

Click on "View all filters" to find the desired filter since this page still shows in alphabetical order.
fields.summary: Filters are not sorted alphabetically

fields.description:
*Summary :*

The ability to generate a *time tracking* report which includes all *fix versions*, ** including release and unreleased is currently unavailable. 

*Suggestion:*

When generating a *Time tracking report*, implement the option to include all issues for all *fix versions*, this includes for issues with No fix versions as well.
fields.summary: Include all Fix versions for Time Tracking Report

fields.description:
All Atlassian Labs plugins we have in Marketplace are currently marked as unsupported.
Example:

- [Javascript chart for Jira cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214527/javascript-charts-for-jira-cloud]

We receive support requests for these add-ons. Also, many customers are seeking documentation that is often missing.
This ticket is created to have a focused space for discussing the requests we receive for these plugins and whether we plan to provide support/documentation for any or all of them.
fields.summary: Support for Atlassian Labs add-ons

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the edit link option and clicking anywhere out of the box of the edit link, it causes only the link to be edited while the text to display remains unchanged. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter a link into an issue description.
 # Edit the link and remove a part of the URL.
 # Click anywhere on the screen outside the edit link box.
 # Check the Edit link option again which now will have different entries in the "Link" and "Text to display" fields.

h3. Expected Results

The "Text to display" gets updated similar to the link.
h3. Actual Results

The "Text to display" and "Link" is different.
h3. Workaround

Pressing "Enter" after making the changes in the link results in the correct appending of the link.
fields.summary: UI bug when using edit link option in editor

fields.description:
Go to _Administrator > Admin Helper > Permission Helper_, subtask is not consider an issue to choose from. As you can see the following:
 !Selection_008.png|thumbnail!
 DEMO-9 is a subtask as we can see as follows
fields.summary: Permission Helper in Administrator page Not showing Sub-task

fields.description:
At the moment, it's not possible to disable the option to delete the scheme while configuring a custom field. So user would easily delete the scheme unintentionally which make it hard to maintain data consistency. 

It would be a "nice to have" feature to be able to disable the option to delete the whole scheme with one button to avoid the scenario mentioned above. Alternatively, a warning message should be displayed on the page to avoid the user to delete it accidentally.
fields.summary: Disable the ability to delete the configuration scheme while configuring custom field

fields.description:
Having read the answer in this previous Jira suggestion, I would like to offer a suggestion of at least a VISUAL INDICATOR that a Task or Sub-task has time logged against it, as you view it in the parent Story. Some little distinctive icon would help to determine if ANY time is logged so far on a task or sub-task, without having to open each one.

Currently, when on a Story, and you are analyzing the progress, you cannot easily see whether time is already logged on a Task or sub-task, and it would be very help in making decisions about that Story vis a vis it's current Sprint and expectations to get it done, or move to another Sprint.
fields.summary: Visual Indicator on Tasks / Sub-Tasks that some time has been logged on it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new issue view offers a specific frame where you can see the information/fields from third-party apps:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-21 at 09.27.56.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-01-21 at 09.28.02.png|thumbnail! 

But, currently, if the app's button is on the last positions on the right side of the screen, in a way that you will need to scroll up after clicking on it, the top of the modal will be cut-off.

See the recording:  [^Third-party app frame cut off.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Have a third-party app installed;
* Have its field positioned in the last positions that are being displayed in the issue view;
* Click on the app's field -> scroll up.

h3. Expected Results

Once you scroll up, the modal will keep unmodified.

h3. Actual Results

The top of the modal (button to go back to the other fields) will be cut off.

h3. Workaround

It seems to be a matter fo resolution. Opening in full screen when you can still see the the app's button will not have that behaviour when scrolling. 

Also, zooming out in your browser will also fix the view.
fields.summary: Third-party app modal cut off in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Can't edit Description field through detail view of backlog on Next-gen projects when using Safari.
When clicking on the description field, it expands as expected, but clicking on it to edit or simply typing doesn't do anything. 
 !image-2020-01-20-17-01-02-943.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Backlog page of a Next-gen project with detail view
 # Click on an issue to open it on the right side
# Expand the description field by clicking on it
# Try to insert any text in it

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to edit the field.

h3. Actual Results
User is not able to edit the field.

h3. Workaround
Open the full-view of the issue or use a different browser.
fields.summary: Can't edit Description field through detail view of backlog on Next-gen projects when using Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a comment containing the single quote (') character from the "Add Flag" option on a board shows HTML character code "'" in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any board > Right-click on a card > Add flag
# Add a comment with single quotes (e.g. I'm) >Go to new issue view to check the comment containing the equivalent HTML code
 !Screenshot 2020-01-20 at 18.56.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Adding a comment with single quotes (e.g. I'm) should not the equivalent HTML code

h3. Actual Results
Adding a comment with single quotes (e.g. I'm) contains the equivalent HTML code

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Adding a comment containing the single quote (') character from the "Add Flag" option on a board shows HTML character code "'" in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a filter results gadget, you can select the *Status* field to be displayed as a column.

But, currently it is not treating the scenario where there are Next-gen projects in the results in the best way.

When sorting by statuses, it will sort Next-gen project's statuses like if they were different even though they have the same name due to the scope restriction.

The same discrepancy occurs between Classic and Next-gen issues in the gadget.

As the final result, when sorting the ordering of statuses, it will take each Next-gen project in consideration, and then sort each one of them by their statuses:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-20 at 08.52.02.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-01-20 at 08.51.52.png|thumbnail! 

The gadget will first group by project, then, by status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a filter that returns results from 2  Next-gen projects;
* Create a *Filter results* gadget;
* Select the *Status* field to be displayed as a column in the gadget, and save the settings;
* Click on the *Status* column to order the results by status.

h3. Expected Results

All issues will be displayed ordered by status only.

h3. Actual Results

The issues are ordered by project, then status.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Filter results gadget inconsistency with Next-gen statuses

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Since the "Profile Visibility" feature released , user with Atlassian Account only able to update profile languge at id.atlassian.com. It is not possible for the Administrator to bulk update the user profile language.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to bulk update user profile language.

h3. Why this is important
 This is important when the customer viewing JIRA and Customer Portal in different language. It's difficult for admin to guide the user to update it from id.atlassian.com. It's best if this can be done by the administrator.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Able to bulk update user profile ( Atlassian Account ) language

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Mention users by typing ~username like the one in the old editor - wiki markup (old issue view)
fields.summary: Mention users by typing ~username like the one in the wiki markup (old issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira user cannot see "share" and "actions" button of sub-task  in Next-gen roadmap when parent's issue title is Japanese and it's long.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an epic that has a long Japanese title like below.
#* 次世代プロジェクトのロードマップで日本語の長いタイトルの場合にメニューが表示されない 
# Create subtask of above epic
# Select subtask issue in roadmap

h3. Expected Results
User can see all buttons correctly.

h3. Actual Results
User cannot see "share" and "actions" button.  If the title of the epic is English works fine even if it's so long.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-20 11.03.35.png|thumbnail! 
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-20 11.09.11.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira user cannot see "share" and "actions" button of sub-task  in Next-gen roadmap when parent's issue title is Japanese and it's long.

fields.description:
Recently Atlassian enabled 2FA for domain accounts which is a good first step...however you've only addressed half the problem.

What about all the accounts on a domain we don't manage?

As an IT Administrator for my organisation, I want to force ALL users to have 2FA enabled if they plan to access our sites. So I would like to see a setting added to Jira, Confluence, etc which is:

Force non-domain accounts to have 2FA enabled
Until they setup 2FA on their Atlassian account, they can't access our site.
fields.summary: Force non-domain accounts to enable 2FA before they can access your account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to add users within the People page which has around 5K+ users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and navigate to "People" page
# Add 5k+ more users to a role. 
# Click on *Add people*

h3. Expected Results
* You are able to add new users

h3. Actual Results
* When you try to select a role for the user it says that the user is using Jira Free and we can't add the user.

_Project roles aren't editable on the Free plan. Upgrade for advanced team configuration_

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

The following error is thrown on the console:
{noformat}
message: “Failed to load roles and parties”
event: {message: “Fetch call failed with status code: 504”}
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Cloud instances have a limit of 5k users, however, it is still possible to add *Service Desk portal-only* accounts to project roles.

h3. Workaround
Add users using [REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-role-id-put]:
{code}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://INSTANCE_URL.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}' \
  --user 'email@example.com:<api_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "group": [
    "test"
  ]
}'
{code}
fields.summary: Not able to add users within the People page which has around 5K+ users

fields.description: Support for Palemoon browser using Jira Software
fields.summary: Support for Palemoon browser using Jira Software

fields.description: At the moment, bullet list only displays as black dot. Please allow users to be able to select different type of bullet list, such as star *, and dash -.
fields.summary: Ability to customize bullet list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Activity Stream in Jira may show as loading and never end depending on a few configuration parameters:
!loading.png|thumbnail!

Notice that this loading page always shows in Activity Streams. This bug is that this never ends for a set of configuration.

The faulty configuration includes (but is not restricted to) country and language configuration, so users with country/language configuration as Russia(RU)/Russian (ru), Brazil(BR)/Portuguese(pt) and China(CN)/Chinese(zh), for example, may be affected by the issue. Other languages and country combinations my be impacted.

h4. Technical details

Jira uses a GET to the {{/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr}} endpoint to generate the Activity Stream. That operation fails *consistently* when using a set of URL parameters, which may happen depending on the configuration of the gadget. 

Here's an example of URL parameters that *consistently fail* (tested several times in more than one instance, this fails consistently, but changing some parameters fixes it):
* container=atlassian
* mid=<id>
* country=RU
* lang=ru
** For country and language, we found out that the combination RU/ru fails, BR/pt fails, CN/zh fails, but US/en doesn't. Also, combinations such as RU/pt and BR/ru don't fail either, probably because there is no Russian in Brazil or Portuguese in Russia, for example, and it switches to English by default.
* view=default
* view-params=\{"writable":"true"\}
** If we use \{"writable":"false"\} instead, it works, even using the other faulty parameters
* st=atlassian:<token>
* up_isConfigured=true
** If you use false here instead, it won't open the Activity Stream, but a dropdown menu to select options, so it needs to be true to replicate
* up_isReallyConfigured=false
** Setting this to true fixes the problem, so it needs to be false to replicate
* up_title=<title>
* up_titleRequired=true
** The title and the 'title required' options do not seem to impact this bug.
* up_numofentries=10
** Modifying this one did not seem to cause of fix the bug
* up_refresh=false
** This one also does not seem to impact
* up_maxProviderLabelCharacters=50
** This one also does not seem to impact
* up_rules=
* up_renderingContext=
* up_keys=
* up_itemKeys=
* up_username=
* url=https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/activitystream-gadget.xml
* libs=auth-refresh

The parameters that seem sensitive to this bug and when changed cause the bug to stop happening seems to be:
* country
* lang
* view-params
* up_isReallyConfigured

h3. Steps to Reproduce

It may be complicated to identify all set of configurations necessary to cause this bug. You may be able to replicate this if you have a country and language set to those faulty ones, or you can do this:
# Open a browser with the Development panel (network tab) open or any other tool that captures the outgoing HTTP calls
# Open a dashboard with the Activity Stream
# Find the request to {{/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr}} and copy it with URL parameters
# Edit the main 4 parameters mentioned above to the faulty values (check description)

h3. Expected Results

The Activity Stream loads correctly.

h3. Actual Results

It keeps loading but never finished:
!loading.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
No verified workaround, though changing lauguage may help
fields.summary: Some configuration, including language and country, causes Activity Streams to load forever

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not possible to download / preview attachments in Android Mobile JIRA app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment (non-image) to a Confluence page
# Using the Confluence Cloud mobile app for iOS, open the same page
# Tap the attachment

h3. Expected Results

The attachment should open and you should have an option to preview, open it with a different app and/or save it.

h3. Actual Results
An error has occurred.

h3. Workaround

If you tap and hold it, you are redirected to the browser version of JIRA Cloud.
There, if you log in, you can see the file and then, by clicking at the share button, you can select to open with a different app and/or save it.
fields.summary: Not possible to download attachments in Android Mobile Jira app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Email delivery from cloud instance is delayed and does not get delivered because Sparkpost is not trying to connect to the secondary MX if the primary MX of the mail server is unresponsive. We can see the following error reported in the logs at our end:
{noformat}
451 4.4.1 [internal] No valid hosts (unable to make any connections)
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup primary and secondary MX record for your mail server
 # Make sure that you cannot connect to the primary MX record 

h3. Expected Results
When primary MX record is not responsive, Sparkpost should connect to the secondary MX record of the mail server to try to deliver the emails

h3. Actual Results
Sparkpost continues to try to connect to the primary MX to deliver the emails and does not try to connect to the secondary MX 

{noformat}
451 4.4.1 [internal] No valid hosts (unable to make any connections)
OR
554 5.4.7 [internal] message timeout (exceeded max time, last transfail: 451 4.4.1 [internal] No valid hosts (unable to make any connections))
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Update the working secondary MX record as primary MX after which the emails will start getting delivered

Notes
We are currently working with Sparkpost to resolve this issue
fields.summary: Email delivery from cloud instance is delayed and does not get delivered because Sparkpost is not trying to connect to the secondary MX if the primary MX of the mail server is unresponsive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70494].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Chrome version 80 is set to ship in February 2020. With this release there are some new cookie security features coming that will force Chrome clients to enforce a SameSite check policy. Right now, this policy would break all the functionality of issue collectors that appear on separate domains.
 If the issue collector could set the SameSite=None in the cookie it appears that it could at least allow the issue collectors to work on different sites.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Inside a Chrome browser, go to address of chrome://flags and find entry called 'SameSite by default cookies' change this from default to Enabled (this feature is expected to ship in official Chrome 80 version on by default, hence this is something we should look to support, even if this specific version is not yet officially supported).
 # Then in my Jira Cloud site, I created a new issue collector
 # Copy the javascript of the issue collector and enter it into a site on a different domain

h3. Expected Results

Issue collector works as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Issue collector does not work. When the user click the expand button, they are presented with an error asking them to enable 3rd party cookies

!issuecollectorChromeSamesite.png|thumbnail!
{code:java}
We noticed that you have third-party cookies disabled in your browser. We need this enabled to correctly submit your feedback. Once youve enabled cookies, please refresh the page. 
{code}
The browser console log has an info message of
{code:java}
A cookie associated with a cross-site resource at <URL> was set without the `SameSite` attribute. It has been blocked, as Chrome now only delivers cookies with cross-site requests if they are set with `SameSite=None` and `Secure`. You can review cookies in developer tools under Application>Storage>Cookies and see more details at <URL> and <URL>.
Dashboard.jspa:1 A cookie associated with a cross-site resource at http://atlassian.net/ was set without the `SameSite` attribute. It has been blocked, as Chrome now only delivers cookies with cross-site requests if they are set with `SameSite=None` and `Secure`. You can review cookies in developer tools under Application>Storage>Cookies and see more details at https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5088147346030592 and https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5633521622188032. 
{code}
h3. Notes:

This feature can be enabled on most modern versions of Chrome such as 79.0.3945.117 (my current version) and also within Canary versions such as Version 81.0.4029.0 (Official Build) canary (64-bit). 
 The expectation though is that Chrome will implement this feature as on by default when a stable version of v80 is released. [https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html] explains this further.
{quote}Mozilla has affirmed their support of the new cookie classification model with their [intent to implement|https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/mozilla.dev.platform/nx2uP0CzA9k/BNVPWDHsAQAJ] the *_SameSite=None; Secure_* requirements for cross-site cookies in Firefox. Microsoft recently [announced|https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!msg/blink-dev/AknSSyQTGYs/8lMmI5DwEAAJ] plans to begin implementing the model starting as an experiment in Microsoft Edge 80.
{quote}
h3. Workaround
 # In Chrome you could go to chromes://flags
 # Find the entry for 'SameSite by default cookies'
 # Set this to Disabled
 # Relaunch Chrome
fields.summary: Issue Collectors won't work for clients using Chrome 80 which enables new samesite cookie controls

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some instances are ignoring the personal locale setting and loads English in some UIs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences. 
# Change the language to Japanese(日本語)
# Wait for 10 minutes
# Access Jira

h3. Expected Results
Sidebar menus are translated.

h3. Actual Results
Jira sidebar and project sidebar menus are not translated. I confirmed this occurring both of JSD and JSW, however, the project setting sidebar menus are translated fine.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-15 15.58.47.png|thumbnail! 
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-15 15.37.36.png|thumbnail! 
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-15 15.41.54.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: UI translation not loaded for some instances

fields.description:
Enhance the Status Category context by allowing it to be exported externally.  

We need to be able to track work/workflow/status at a more detailed level however for some reporting we only care about the To Do, In Progress and Done.  Unfortunately, we cannot export the Status Category which would allow us to do so.
fields.summary: Allow Export of Status Category

fields.description:
Problem - With regards to inline issue creation, currently if in any project, any other field is marked as mandatory except "Reporter", "Issue Type" and "Summary" then it throws an error "You can only create issue types supporting inline issue creation" 

Suggestion -  Built-in fields like Components and Fix versions should be supported.
fields.summary: Inline issue creation should be customised in a way that built in fields could be supported

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no option to enable receiving notifications when users to mention themselves

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to be able to mention themselves without needing to enable the Notification of your own changes in the Profile settings

h3. Why this is important
Tagging yourself is not a change, it is a deliberate action to tag yourself because you want to notify yourself
fields.summary: Bug - Notification for Self Mentions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In new issue view, Status option is not available to change whereas is accessible in Old issue view.

*Solution summary:*

Tracked at  [https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/BENTO-5729] - long-term backlog
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Cannot be reproduced.
h3. Expected Results

New issue view should have Status option visible.
h3. Actual Results

Status option is not available to change whereas is accessible in Old issue view.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: In new issue view, Status option is not available to change whereas is accessible in Old issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to search for multibyte dashboards when searching by 3+ characters

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a dashboard named プロジェクト全体ダッシュボード
# In the dashboard, click "View all dashboards" from the sidebar
# Search with "プロジェクト全体ダッシュボード" 

h3. Expected Results
The dashboard created in step 1 will show up

h3. Actual Results
The dashboard created in step 1 won't show up

h3. Workaround
Shorten the search term to two chars. In the sample above, searching by "プロ" will work

h3. Note
Changing the Jira indexing language to Japanese won't work
fields.summary: Unable to search for multibyte dashboards when searching by 3+ characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in Jira's Look and Feel, the Favicon does not support the usage of .ico format.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the support of .ico format for Favicon for Jira
fields.summary: Add the support of .ico format for Favicon in Jira Look and Feel

fields.description: Availability to disable Google Sheets add-on
fields.summary: Availability to disable Google Sheets add-on

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67952].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Project admins can add or remove any users to their project by adding/removing the user directly to the project or to a project role.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Jira admins a configurable option so that they can disable this ability, if desired. 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to prevent project admins from adding or removing users to a project

fields.description:
Using the Slack Integration and configuring JQL to match the specific event you want doesn't show the error of the JQL if it's not correct.

It would be nice, if an error can be return if the JQL is wrong to tell you want went wrong within the JQL query rather than performing all JQL from the Issue Navigator Advance Search.
fields.summary: Ability for Slack Integration to validate JQL query

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching JQL using updatedBy(), eg: issuekey IN updatedBy(jsmith, "-8d"), it returns all issues which was updated in the last 8 days and was historically updated by jsmith beyond 8 days
This feature was recently announced at https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/12/atlassian-cloud-changes-dec-23-to-dec-30-2019
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # search for an issue which was updated for the last 8 days and was updated by jsmith 9 days ago
 # in JQL, search {code}issuekey IN updatedBy(jsmith, "-8d"){code}

h3. Expected Results
Only returns the issue which was updated by jsmith the last 8 days
h3. Actual Results
Returns all of the issues which were updated by jsmith before and updated by anyone the last 8 days

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching JQL using updatedBy() returns all issues out of the requested timestamp

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Opening project Summary, switching from Activity to Statistics and to Activity redirects to the board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Project Summary
# You'll arrive at the Activity panel (https://<instance>/projects/<pKey>/summary)
# Switch to Statistics (https://<instance>/projects/<pKey>/summary/statistics
# Switch back to Activity (https://<instance>/projects/<pKey>/summary/summary/activity
** Here, due to the link being summary/summary/activity, you'll be redirected to the board

* https://cl.ly/788483854c48

h3. Expected Results
The link should be again (https://<instance>/projects/<pKey>/summary) and redirect back to the Activity Panel

h3. Actual Results
The link when at the Summary, adds an additional summary path and activity and redirects to the board

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening project Summary, switching from Activity to Statistics and to Activity redirects to the board

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently if the the 'Allow unassigned issues' is turned off in general configuration, the quick create feature in boards will be disabled. Users will not be able to create any issues from the board directly when this configuration is turned off. 

It will be great if there is a notification that warns of this in the board view which users can choose to not show again once acknowledged. 

Currently there is no warning that this configuration can cause issues with the quick issue creation feature in boards. Due to this users will not know what has gone wrong.
fields.summary: Notification pop up if 'Allow unassigned issues' is turned off for board quick create feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When linking two Jira issues through a transition modal, using the "relates to" symbiotic link type, creates a duplicate link if the Jira issues already have a "relates to" link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic service desk project using the External Service project template
# Create an issue of type bug
# Create a linked issue with the "relates to" issue link type.
# Transition the original issue to pending. this will trigger a transition modal with the option to link an issue.
# In the transition modal, create another link to the same issue of a "relates to" type.

h3. Expected Results
Only one link is created as the second is a duplicate

h3. Actual Results
Two links are created

h3. Workaround
Don't create the second link / only link issues through the issue view, not in the transition modal.
fields.summary: Linking two Jira issues through a transition modal creates duplicate links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to link a Confluence overview page from linked Jira, an error will be returned and it is unable to proceed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the URL for a Confluence space overview page(https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space key>/overview
# Switch to Jira
# In the new issue view, click "Link page" and paste the URL. Select the suggested page title and click "Link"

h3. Expected Results
The links will be saved.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown and the link won't be saved.
{code}
We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again.
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
Update the URL to paste by the following:
# In Confluence, navigate to the target overview page
# Use the steps described at https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-confluence-page-id-648380445.html to get a page ID
# Update the URL to paste in the following format:
{code}
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space key>/pages/<extracted page ID>
{code}

h3. Note
This is happening in the old issue view too
fields.summary: Linking to Confluence overview page results in an error

fields.description: Availability to modify YOUR WORK layout screen, to add more fields and columns
fields.summary: Availability to modify YOUR WORK layout screen

fields.description: I would like to be able to see a single Roadmap that included Roadmap content from multiple projects. This allows me to synchronize across projects.
fields.summary: View a consolodated Roadmap across multople projects

fields.description:
If the JQL results are over 1K, the number returned is now 1,000+. 

The query counts are incredibly important and we need them back.  I need to know the count of my query.  Period.

This is very frustrating. 

Corresponding support ticket: 

[https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-541097?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=61e5b0b0-6a20-4dd6-b82b-55748e07ec41]
fields.summary: Bring back the query results counts

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When using a next-gen project or enabling the new issue view for classic ones, currently, the Create issue screen still shows the old view. It was already mentioned that it affects the format of the description (JRACLOUD-71890 and JRACLOUD-73551) because the renderer is different, but it also affects users who would like to use the fields that look better on the new view, like the checkbox, for example.
h3. Suggestion

Add the new view to the "Create" screen.

 

New view:

!new view.gif|width=294,height=247!

Old view:

!old view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New issue view for "Create Issue" screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

MacApp crashes when trying to update the selected issue type using the dropdown list during the issue creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a Software project and enable the Backlog (in case you are using the Kanban Board);
 # Create one issue using the in-line creation by keeping the pre-selected issue type. This will work as expected;
# Try to create another issue by at this time select a different issue type.

*Video reproducing the behavior:* 
* In-line:  [^createIssueBug.mp4] 
* From the + button:  [^createIssueBug_2.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

The new issue type will be selected and you will be able to move forward with the creation.

h3. Actual Results

The Jira App crashes.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: MacApp crashes when trying to update the selected issue type using the dropdown list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to add individual users to team in Tempo.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Navigate to a team in Tempo;
* Click on *Add Member*;
* Try searching for users.

h3. Expected Results

Users list will be populated so you can select one.

h3. Actual Results

No results are returned:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-13 at 12.20.16.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-01-13 at 12.20.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The workaround is *Bulk adding*, which is done by using by groups. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot add individual users to Tempo teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When in the issue search navigator, you are able to use keyboard shortcuts to assign issues, add labels, etc.

Currently, if the *Jira Labs* feature is active (which activates the new issue view), the shortcuts will not work at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Activate *Jira Labs* in your profile settings:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-13 at 10.20.14.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-01-13 at 10.20.25.png|thumbnail! 
* Try to use the keyboard shortcuts in the issue search navigator when in *List View*:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-13 at 10.22.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The shortcuts will work.

h3. Actual Results

Pressing the keys in the keyboard has no effect.

See the recording:  [^Keyboard shortcut - issue search list view.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

You can deactivate the *Jira Labs* feature, but that will also deactivate the new issue view.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts not working in the issue search navigator List view when Jira Labs is active

fields.description:
Currently, in the portal and new issue view, the *Files & images* icon used for adding an attachment to a ticket is an icon of an image file. It would be better if it was something more generic and associated with different types of attachments (e.g., a paper clip).

Having it as an image file can cause confusion for some users.
fields.summary: Change the Files & images (Attachments) icon to a paper clip

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's not possible to create new issue security levels inside an issue security scheme. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Settings > Issues;
 # Under ISSUES ATTRIBUTES, select Issue Security Schemes;
 # Create an issue security scheme or select an existing one;

h3. Expected Results
Users should have the possibility to create a new level.

h3. Actual Results
There isn't a button to create a new one.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Option to create new security levels is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the dates of date and time picker fields are displayed in the issue search navigator (list view) as relative. You can see the absolute value by hovering over it only:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-10 at 11.45.43.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

Implement the ability to modify the date format to absolute without the need of hovering over it to see that format.

Similar to what the new view offers at this time, where you can simply click on the date:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-10 at 11.36.53.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2020-01-10 at 11.37.00.png|thumbnail!

P.S: The field starts displaying as absolute once the date selected in the field is at least 8 days before the current date.
fields.summary: Issue search navigator list view date format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Business Board breaks after adding multiple workflows in the projects for a different issue type

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 issue types (Bug, Task, and Candidate)
 # Assign Task and Candidate with workflow A then assign Bug with workflow B

h3. Expected Results
The board should appear as usual

h3. Actual Results
The board Breaks
 !image-2020-01-10-21-42-50-551.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

At the moment no workaround is available for this Bug
fields.summary: Business Board breaks after adding multiple workflows in the projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira throws an error while cloning issues with extended summaries

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with a summary that contains 255 characters
 # Try cloning the issue

h3. Expected Results
A message informing the characters limits was exceeded.

h3. Actual Results
Error on UI:
{code}Can't clone this issue. org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting. (Privacy-safe boxing of a org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException)
{code}

h3. Workaround
Update the issue summary to match the limit
fields.summary: Jira throws an error while cloning issues with extended summaries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While performing searches that return more than 1000 tickets Jira is displaying “+1000” tickets instead of the actual number of tickets.

 !image-2020-01-09-15-29-11-806.png|thumbnail! 

Ideally, Jira should display the actual number of issues.

h3. Workaround

There's no workaround at this moment.
- An alternative solution is to use the *Filter Counts* gadget for projects with fewer than 9999 issues.
 !image-2020-01-09-15-29-23-791.png|thumbnail! 
- Another option is the *Starred Filters* gadget, which retrieves even more tickets.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add back the ability to see total number of tickets in issue navigator

fields.description: I'd like to have the ability to choose the old comment text editor instead of being force to use rich text only (Or switch back to old view before being able to edit with plain textile markup)
fields.summary: Old comment editor instead of the rich text version in the new issue view

fields.description: Availability to send an email notification when a comment has a reaction
fields.summary: Send email notification when a comment has a reaction

fields.description: Global Admin must able to edit the filter's permission without being the group. Currently, even the admin has to be in the group in order to share the filters. The situation makes the admin be parts of many groups in order to add the filter.
fields.summary: Global Admin must able to edit the filters permission without being the group

fields.description:
Add the availability to select if push notification needs to be sent or not by making a bulk change on Jira desktop, this option is available on desktop.

 !image-2020-01-08-17-32-04-124.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Availability  to select if push notification needs to be sent or not by making a bulk change on Jira desktop
